original_title: Removing the Air Gap From an iPad Display
original_content:
Some recent models of the Apple iPad have a rather annoying air gap in between the display and the outer touch surface. This can be particularly frustrating for users that press hard or use the Apple Pencil regularly. It is possible to eliminate this gap in the iPad 9, at least, as demonstrated by [serg1us_eng]. (Warning: TikTok)
Doing the job well takes some finesse, however, and plenty of fancy equipment. The iPads front touch glass was first covered to avoid scratches during the work, and then heated to 60 C to remove it. The display was also removed, with several glued-down ribbon cables having to be carefully pried off to avoid damage. A layer of transparent material was then cut to size to fit in the gap between the display and the front glass, with the stack laminated together. Getting this result without air bubbles or dust particles spoiling the result involved the use of a heated press and a clean room, which are now widely used in phone repair shops around the world.
For the average user, it might not be a big deal. For power users and touch-and-feel fanatics, though, theres great appeal in an iPad without this annoying flaw. Video after the break.

title: iPad 9のディスプレイと外部タッチサーフェスの間にある気になるエアギャップを解消する方法
body: 【要約】一部のApple iPadには、ディスプレイと外側のタッチサーフェスの間に邪魔な空気の層があります。この問題を解消する方法が示されています。作業には繊細さと高性能な機器が必要で、清潔な環境で実施されます。一般的なユーザーにはそれほど問題ではありませんが、パワーユーザーや感覚にこだわる人には魅力的です。
